data.title: Fast open file from explorer without put focus on it
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

Open multiple files with command+enter (MacOs) : 
![openfile](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5599375/29563083-5adbf482-873c-11e7-9376-16be32c1acdd.gif)

Each time a file open i automaticly switch into the editor. This is the only behaviour forcing me to use a mouse in vscode when i want to open multiples files.

Expected behaviour:
- I can open 3 files in a row, without focus each file once open.

We definitly need a way to fast open multiple file (and save then to opened files) without focusing each file.

I did not find an option or a key binding allowing that, and macro (with extensions) are not working.

data.title: Default target of Configuration API update should be derived from configuration and resource
data.body:
To make it easier for extension author using workspace config update api, VS Code should derive the default target (if not provided) from the configuration and resource.

- If no resource is provided, then target should be Workspace.
- If configuration is workbench scoped, then target should be Workspace.
- If configuration is resource scoped and resource is provided then
-- target is WorkspaceFolder in MR case
-- target is Workspace otherwise

cc @dbaeumer

data.title: Migrate workspace settings when shifting from single folder to workspace mode
data.body:
Migrate window specific settings when shifting from single folder to workspace mode

cc: @bpasero

data.title: Multi root: revisit workspace file format
data.body: /cc @sandy081

data.title: Multi root: transition without window reload
data.body:
Now that we can restart the extension host we should explore to enter multi-root workspace mode from 0 or 1 folder workspace without requiring a window reload.

This requires all users of the `IWorkspaceContextService` to be ready for the transition of zero or one folder into a workspace without window reload. The following larger components need to be adopted:
* [ ] Foundation (local storage, workspace, workspace editing, configuration, configuration editing) @sandy081 @bpasero
* [ ] Explorer @isidorn 
* [ ] Task @dbaeumer 
* [ ] Debug @isidorn 
* [ ] Preferences @sandy081 
* [ ] Search @roblourens 
* [ ] Extensions (enablement, recommendations) @sandy081 

Instead of statically checking for a workspace being present or not, these components should subscribe to the `onDidChangeWorkspaceRoots` event and handle all cases (0 folders, 1 folder, N folders).

data.title: Commands: make title optional
data.body:
When developing extensions I usually use a function that retrieves the contributed commands from `package.json` and for each of them calls `vscode.commands.registerCommand` with the proper handler.

The problem is that one can register a command that doens't have a title, but you can't write it in `package.json` because there the title is required.

I think commands shouldn't be forced to have a title. In case they don't have it those commands simply shouldn't be available in the Command Palette.

Another problem with the current approach is that those hard-coded commands won't be displayed under the `Contributions` page of an extension.

What do you think?

- VSCode Version: Version 1.15.1 (1.15.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Check out the extension [here](https://github.com/jackalcooper/bucklescript-tea-tools).
2. install node dependency and run it with `F5`
3. Toggle command: "BuckleScript-TEA: Convert HTML to DSL in OCaml"
4. It should work

5. Install this extension from marketplace. Its name: `BuckleScript-TEA Tools`
6. Toggle command: "BuckleScript-TEA: Convert HTML to DSL in OCaml" in a non-debug instance of VS Code
4. It says:
```
command 'bucklescriptTeaTools.htmlToView' not found
```

data.title: We should have a workspace folder picker API in the Extension host
data.body: Extensions now need to scope certain actions (like settings changes) to a workspace folder. In a multi workspace folder setup the need to ask the user which folder to use. To make such a picker the same for all extensions we should offer API for this.

- VSCode Version: 1.15.0 - OS Version: 4.4.0-91-generic (Ubuntu 16.04) **Steps to Reproduce**: Given the following html in the editor window: ```html

what it is

  • fun
  • social
  • beneficial
  • relevant
  • educative
  • rewarding
``` If I Copy and Paste that on a new line at the first caret position, Then the pasted html in editor now looks like this: ```html

what it is

  • fun
  • social
  • beneficial
  • relevant
  • educative
  • rewarding
``` **Error**: Everything in the pasted snippet except the first `
` is indented by 2 additional spaces Sometimes after pasting only the last tag is indented with 2 pages and sporadically just the first tag. Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: why autocomplete is fuzzy matching
data.body:
I have a special scenario, when type string starts with '@' then a complete list will be given which is returned from server side by using the string after '@' for querying. But there is a question confused me, when continue type the handler registered through connection.onCompletion() will not triggered again if the previous list after filtering is not empty by default the strategy seems like fuzzy mathing but in my situtation the result may not the better.Details is below
1. in user setting set editor.quickSuggestions on
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10389980/29550266-75cc8826-873f-11e7-817c-8400e95c19f5.gif)
2. if i set trigger characters on language-server connection.onInitialize() like 
completionProvider: {
					resolveProvider: false,
					triggerCharacters:["e","n","g","i","r"]
				},
then each time i type a char which is in triggerCharacters will trigger handler, this is what i want when type a char each time should trriger handler, is neccessary to assign all chacters? this seems not smart, is there simple method can reach my needs? any suggestions will appreciated.
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10389980/29550480-861707a0-8740-11e7-93a8-5f46e5b4fc21.gif)


My project is based on official language-server demo, in order to implement code completion. But in my situation the completion list was got through sending http request to my server side. In one words, what i want is each time i type a char registered handler should be invoked.

data.title: Don't indent case labels within switch
data.body:
VSCode has started to indent case labels in switch statements in JavaScript since the July 2017 release. It didn't do this previously and there's no setting (AFAIK) to change this behaviour back. BTW most style guides and also ESLint by default prefer not to indent the case labels.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a switch statement with case labels
2. Use the "Format Document" command

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Custom Emmet snippets could not use by 1.15.1 update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1 - OS Version: win10 x64 I can hardly speak English, I'm sorry. I will ask a question using google translation. In order to use custom emmet snippets I had written the following in snippets.json. ~~~~ "html": { "snippets": { "c": "class=\"|\"", "_": "target=\"_blank\"" } } ~~~~ For example ~~~~
~~~~ I will input it like this. ~~~~
~~~~ When expanded, it becomes as follows. ~~~~
~~~~ ![](https://i.gyazo.com/492f6788105d0d88955ebacad9a230e7.gif) In the case of a element ~~~~ ~~~~ I will input it like this ~~~~ ~~~~ When expanded, it becomes as follows. ~~~~ ~~~~ ![](https://i.gyazo.com/b7d3ce1742b8588050f61cf424c04e58.gif) In css, I had written the following in snippets.json. ~~~~ "css": { "snippets": { ":h": ":hover {\n\t|\n}" } } ~~~~ For example ~~~~ .test { } ~~~~ I will input it like this ~~~~ .test { &:h } ~~~~ When expanded, it becomes as follows. ~~~~ .test { &:hover { } } ~~~~ ![](https://i.gyazo.com/e7c4ff2829b9eeff48d1efe54f3ecd19.gif) Before 1.14 it worked without problems. However it became impossible to expanded it by updating to 1.15.1 the other day. I read[ this page](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/emmet) but I could not solve it. I have created a lot of snippets and it is very inconvenient if I can not use them. Could you help me to resolve this issue? Thank you.

data.title: Node.js, open the project folder, rename the project folder and open it again
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T18:07:25.676Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Node.js, open the project folder, rename the project folder and open it again
2.
